item.title: 尽管有降息预期，加拿大企业仍在控制投资计划
item.description: 作者：Promit Mukherjee【原文：By Promit Mukherjee】

item.title: RTX 单位普惠公司完成发动机升级的初步设计审查
item.description: RTX 公司的普拉特-惠特尼公司（Pratt & Whitney）周一表示，该公司已经完成了发动机升级的初步设计审查，以提高 F-35 战斗机所有三种型号的耐用性和性能。【原文：RTX Corp's Pratt & Whitney said on Monday it has completed the preliminary design review for an engine upgrade to increase durability and performance in all three variants of the F-35 fighter jet.】

item.title: 航空资本公司敲定 35 架波音 737 MAX 喷气式飞机订单
item.description: 航空资本集团（Aviation Capital Group）周一表示，该公司已确定订购 35 架波音 737 MAX 喷气式飞机。【原文：Aircraft lessor Aviation Capital Group has finalized an order for 35 Boeing 737 MAX jets, the companies said on Monday.】

item.title: 优步在英国法院赢得对竞争对手应用程序征税的上诉被推翻
item.description: 周一，法院推翻了关于私人出租运营商与乘客签订合同的裁决，优步（Uber）的竞争对手出租车运营商在伦敦以外地区的利润率将不会面临 20% 的税费。【原文：Uber's rival taxi operators will not face a 20% tax charge on their profit margins outside of London after a court on Monday overturned a ruling that private-hire operators enter into a contract with passengers.】

item.title: KKR 支持的 OneStream 在美国首次公开募股中寻求 43.8 亿美元估值
item.description: OneStream Software 由私募股权公司 KKR 支持，其在美国首次公开募股的目标估值约为 43.8 亿美元。【原文：OneStream Software, which is backed by private equity firm KKR , is targeting a valuation of about $4.38 billion in its U.S. initial public offering.】

item.title: 券商上调标普 500 指数目标，寄望软着陆和降息
item.description: 受经济 "软着陆 "预期和美联储今年降息可能性增大的刺激，券商纷纷上调美股基准 S&P 500 指数的年底目标。【原文：Brokerages have raised their year-end targets for U.S. stocks benchmark S&P 500 , spurred by expectations of a "soft landing" for the economy and growing odds the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates this year.】

item.title: 梅西百货终止与 Arkhouse 和 Brigade 的讨论
item.description: 梅西百货公司周一表示，已终止与 Arkhouse Management 和 Brigade Capital 的讨论，理由是收购这家连锁百货公司的修订方案缺乏融资的确定性，也没有提供令人信服的价值。【原文：Macy's said on Monday it has terminated discussions with Arkhouse Management and Brigade Capital, citing that the revised proposal to buy the department store chain lacks certainty of financing and does not provide compelling value.】

item.title: 欧洲需要独立于中国的关键矿产定价方式，该组织称
item.description: 一个由欧盟资助的小组的负责人说，欧洲需要一个不依赖中国的系统来确定能源转型所需的关键矿产的价格，而中国在全球能源转型领域占据着主导地位。【原文：Europe needs a system to set prices for critical minerals needed for the energy transition that is not dependent on China, which dominates much of the global sector, the head of an EU-funded group said.】

item.title: 数据公司称亚马逊 "Prime Day "销售额将达到创纪录的 140 亿美元
item.description: 据研究电子商务交易数据的 Adobe Analytics 公司预测，在本周亚马逊的 Prime Day 两天购物活动期间，购物者可能会花费大约 140 亿美元。【原文：Shoppers are likely to spend roughly $14 billion during Amazon's Prime Day two-day shopping event this week, according to projections from Adobe Analytics, a firm that studies e-commerce transaction data.】

item.title: 经济萎靡不振，欧洲企业纷纷裁员
item.description: 通胀水平的升高和乌克兰战争的影响迫使欧洲各地的公司冻结招聘或裁员。【原文：Elevated levels of inflation and the impact of the war in Ukraine have forced companies across Europe to freeze hiring or cut jobs.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利称苹果是人工智能领域的 "最佳选择 "后，苹果公司股价上涨
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）上调了这家 iPhone 制造商的目标股价，并将该股列为 "最佳选择"，理由是该公司的人工智能努力将促进设备销售，苹果公司的股价周一上涨了约 2%。【原文：Apple's shares rose about 2% on Monday after Morgan Stanley raised its price target on the iPhone maker's shares and designated the stock as a "top pick," citing the company's AI efforts as a boost to device sales.】

item.title: 高盛因债务承销和固定收益交易强劲而利润大增
item.description: 高盛第二季度的利润增长了一倍多，主要得益于债务承销费用的增加和固定收益交易业务的强劲表现。【原文：Goldman Sachs' profit more than doubled in the second quarter, bolstered by higher fees from debt underwriting and a strong performance in its fixed-income trading business.】

item.title: AutoNation 预计 CDK 故障将影响第二季度利润
item.description: 美国汽车零售商 AutoNation 周一表示，由于零售技术提供商 CDK 在 6 月份的一次网络攻击造成的干扰，该公司第二季度的利润预计将受到每股 1.50 美元的冲击，而 6 月份正是汽车经销商的关键销售期。【原文：U.S. auto retailer AutoNation said on Monday it expects a $1.50 per share hit to its second-quarter profit due to the disruptions caused by a cyberattack at retail technology provider CDK in June, a crucial selling period for car dealers.】

item.title: 美国进口商对 10,000 美元集装箱运费率的回归表示反对
item.description: 将一个标准的 40 英尺集装箱内的玩具、汽车零部件或其他货物从上海运到纽约的成本已跃升至近 10,000 美元，这加剧了进口商的挫败感，并促使一些专家认为市场正处于泡沫之中。【原文：The cost to ship a standard 40-foot container of toys, auto parts or other goods from Shanghai to New York has jumped to nearly $10,000, fueling frustration among importers and prompting some experts to say the market is in a bubble.】

item.title: 法国竞争管理机构确认对英伟达展开调查
item.description: 法国竞争管理机构周一证实，正在对芯片制造商英伟达（Nvidia）涉嫌反竞争的行为进行调查。【原文：The French competition authority confirmed on Monday that an investigation is underway into chipmaker Nvidia over alleged anti-competitive practices.】

item.title: SolarEdge Technologies 将裁员 400 人
item.description: SolarEdge Technologies 周一表示，公司将裁员 400 人，以恢复盈利能力并确保财务稳定。【原文：SolarEdge Technologies said on Monday it would lay off 400 employees, as it works to restore profitability and ensure financial stability.】

item.title: IDC 称第二季度全球智能手机市场增长 6.5%，三星和苹果领跑
item.description: IDC 周一公布的初步数据显示，在三星电子和苹果公司的推动下，第二季度全球智能手机出货量增长了 6.5%，但由于部分市场仍面临挑战，需求尚未全面复苏。【原文：Global smartphone shipments rose 6.5% in the second quarter, driven by Samsung Electronics and Apple, preliminary data from IDC showed on Monday, but a full recovery in demand is yet to come around as it remained challenged in some markets.】

item.title: 枪击案后特朗普胜选几率上升，特朗普媒体和加密货币类股大涨
item.description: 加密货币股、监狱运营商和其他可能受益于唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）就任美国总统的股票在周一盘前交易中跳涨，原因是共和党候选人在一次集会上遭遇暗杀未遂后胜算上升。【原文：Crypto stocks, prison operators and other shares that could benefit from a Donald Trump presidency in the U.S. jumped during premarket trading on Monday as the Republican candidate's odds of winning rose after an assassination attempt at a rally.】

item.title: 市场飙升，贝莱德资产创 10.6 万亿美元新高
item.description: 由于股市走强推动了费用收入的强劲增长，全球最大的基金管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）的资产在第二季度创下了 10.65 万亿美元的历史新高。【原文：Assets of BlackRock , the world's largest money manager, hit a record high of $10.65 trillion in the second quarter and the firm posted a 9% jump in profit on Monday, as stronger equity markets drove robust fee income growth.】

item.title: 克利夫兰克利夫斯公司将以 25 亿美元收购加拿大钢铁制造商 Stelco 公司
item.description: 美国钢铁制造商克利夫兰-克利夫斯公司（Cleveland-Cliffs）周一表示，它将收购加拿大同行 Stelco 控股公司，交易价值为 25 亿美元。【原文：U.S. steelmaker Cleveland-Cliffs said on Monday it would acquire Canadian peer Stelco Holdings in a deal valued at $2.5 billion.】

item.title: 业界称关键矿产投资存疑
item.description: 业内人士表示，由于消费者对电动汽车的需求和政府对零碳目标的承诺存在不确定性，许多公司不愿投资关键矿产和能源转型项目。【原文：Many companies are reluctant to invest in critical minerals and energy transition projects due to uncertainty about consumer demand for EVs and government commitment to zero-carbon goals, industry players said.】

item.title: 独家报道朝鲜黑客向亚洲支付公司使用的钱包发送窃取的加密货币
item.description: 区块链数据显示，柬埔寨一家大型支付公司从朝鲜黑客组织拉扎罗斯（Lazarus）使用的数字钱包中收到了价值超过 15 万美元的加密货币，这是这个犯罪集团如何在东南亚洗钱的一个缩影。【原文：A major Cambodian payments firm received crypto worth over $150,000 from a digital wallet used by North Korean hacking outfit Lazarus, blockchain data shows, a glimpse of how the criminal collective has laundered funds in Southeast Asia.】

item.title: 拖拉机厂裁员，工会工人权衡拜登与特朗普
item.description: 对于位于威斯康星州拉辛市郊外的 CNH 工业公司庞大拖拉机厂的工人来说，关于总统乔-拜登或前总统唐纳德-特朗普是否会采取更多措施来挽救他们的工作，使其不被打包运往墨西哥的争论已经变成了 "友好战争"。【原文：For workers at CNH Industrial's sprawling tractor plant just outside Racine, Wisconsin, debate over whether President Joe Biden or former President Donald Trump would do more to save their jobs from getting packed off to Mexico has turned into "friendly warfare."】

item.title: 关于美国通胀，共和党人不愿说，民主党人不愿谈
item.description: 如果说美国政坛的严重分裂使经济数据的特征成为判断党派归属的可靠依据，那么即将召开的共和党和民主党大会则会将这种现象打上类固醇，放大到 11 倍，而且几乎没有灰色空间。【原文：If the deep split in U.S. politics makes characterizations of economic data a dependable tell about party affiliation, the coming Republican and Democratic conventions will put that phenomenon on steroids, amp it to 11, and leave little room for shades of gray.】

item.title: 早间新闻特朗普打压令经济曲线陡峭；中国经济蹒跚前行
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 枪击事件后特朗普获胜几率上升，期货上涨
item.description: 美国股指期货周一上涨，原因是总统候选人唐纳德-特朗普在未遂暗杀事件中幸存后赢得连任的几率上升，同时降息希望继续提振市场情绪。【原文：U.S. stock index futures rose on Monday on higher odds of presidential candidate Donald Trump winning a second term after surviving an assassination attempt, while interest rate cut hopes continued to lift sentiment.】

item.title: 中国要求世贸组织就美国电动汽车补贴争端成立专家组
item.description: 中国商务部周一表示，中国已向世贸组织提出设立专家组的请求，以审议针对美国《通货膨胀削减法》下的新能源汽车补贴的争端解决。【原文：China has submitted a request to the WTO to set up an expert panel to consider a dispute settlement against new energy vehicle subsides under the U.S. Inflation Reduction Act, China's commerce ministry said on Monday.】

item.title: Yandex NV 完成 54 亿美元出售俄罗斯业务交易
item.description: 俄罗斯技术公司 Yandex 的资产分拆交易于周一敲定，俄罗斯投资者财团以现金加股票的方式收购了 Yandex 的大部分业务，交易价值约 54 亿美元。【原文：A deal to split the assets of Russian technology company Yandex was finalised on Monday, with a Russian consortium of investors buying the bulk of Yandex's businesses in a cash and shares deal worth around $5.4 billion.】

item.title: 高盛任命印度投资银行联席主管和香港业务主管
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）任命 Sudarshan Ramakrishnan 和 Devarajan Nambakam 为印度投资银行业务联席主管，这是华尔街银行在印度交易机会增多的情况下加强领导力的最新举措。【原文：Goldman Sachs has appointed Sudarshan Ramakrishnan and Devarajan Nambakam as co-heads of investment banking in India, the latest Wall Street bank to bolster its leadership amid a rise in dealmaking opportunities in the country.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，高盛计划为首支专注亚洲的私募股权基金投资 20 亿美元
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs）的两位知情人士透露，高盛计划为其首支专注于亚太地区的私募股权基金筹资 20 亿美元。【原文：Goldman Sachs aims to raise $2 billion in its first Asia Pacific-focused private equity fund, two people with knowledge of the bank's fundraising plan said, as it looks to deepen exposure to some of the world's fastest-growing economies.】
